summary: Steven K. Blackhurst served as the Assistant Special Counsel for Intelligence Coordination. Based on the provided documents, Blackhurst's role appears to be primarily related to coordinating intelligence matters and responding to requests from the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities in 1976. The documents indicate his involvement in forwarding requests from the Senate Select Committee to the FBI and ensuring appropriate responses, as well as dealing with security requirements for government employment and investigations of federal employees. He was also involved in discussions regarding the FBI's interactions with the Senate Select Committee, including issues of informant confidentiality and domestic intelligence investigations.
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities
Office of the Deputy Attorney General
significance: Based on the provided documents, Steven K. Blackhurst's significance in the JFK assassination context is indirect. His role involves coordinating intelligence matters and responding to requests from the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities, which was investigating intelligence activities in the 1970s. While the documents do not explicitly mention the JFK assassination, the Senate Select Committee's work could potentially touch upon aspects related to the assassination investigation or related intelligence matters.
